questions.question: I will be staying here for ……………………… more days.
questions.description: A few indicates a small number.

questions.question: He is junior …………………………… me.
questions.description: The words junior and senior are followed by to.

questions.question: China is ………………………… than India.
questions.description: Use a comparative expression before than.

questions.question: He is ………………………….. than her.
questions.description: Younger is the comparative form of young.

questions.question: Of the two routes, this is ………………………………
questions.description: Use the comparative form when a group consists of just two people or things.

questions.question: We got ……………………………….. rain this year. The crops are all dying.
This material is superior ………………………….. that.
questions.description: Use to after superior and inferior.

questions.question: He is ……………………………… of the four men.
questions.description: The superlative is used to compare a person or thing with the group to which they/it belong(s).

questions.question: I do not earn as much as …………………………… does.
questions.description: The subject form is used before a verb.

questions.question: A dog is ……………………………… than a cat.
Hindi ………………………….. in many parts of India.
